Description: Typical range for industrial 1064 nm fiber lasers used in ceramic cleaning; starting at 300 W balances efficiency and safety for SiC's high thermal conductivity (~120 W/m·K) to prevent overheating. Max avoids substrate ablation. Source: IPG Photonics YLR series specs and study in Optics and Lasers in Engineering (2018) on SiC surface preparation.
Near-IR wavelength for optimal SiC absorption and minimal substrate damage
Beam spot diameter for precise cleaning with adequate energy density
Optimal repetition rate for efficient cleaning coverage and thermal management
Nanosecond pulse duration for efficient contaminant removal with controlled thermal effects
Optimal scanning speed for uniform cleaning coverage
Recommended number of passes for complete contaminant removal
Optimal beam overlap for uniform cleaning without excessive thermal buildup
